result.execSummary:
The defendant Dionia O. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, On or Near a School], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $500 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*   Donate $500 to Kenosha County DARE Program.
Perform   100   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.    May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Dionia O. Scott, appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made. 
Count 1 -  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 5 years Consecutive to Count 5. See Conditions - Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs and conditions of probation are the same as conditions of extended supervision.  
Count 5 -  DE is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 38 days.  DE is taken into custody.  See conditions.  Court imposes a fine of $500 plus costs.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied to both counts before refunding any balance.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 5 - DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are Dismissed and Read In.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on October 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant, Dionia Scott appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Court renders oral ruling denying DE's motion to dismiss Count 5 for reasons set forth on the record.  Case remains scheduled for trial on 8/31/15.
State's Response to Defense's Motion to Dismiss and Memorandum of Law, filed by ADA Margaret Drees.
filed by Atty Celebre

Arguments heard on DE's Motion to dismiss and and motion to sever.  Upon hearing arguments motion to sever is denied by the court.  Parties will brief arguments on motion to dismiss and DE to file brief by 7/14/15 and State to file their response brief by 7/28/15.  Court will render oral decision on 8/11/15 at 1:00 PM.
and Affidavit to Dismiss and Affidavit of David E. Celebre.  (Hearing 6/30/15 at 2:30.)
